alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 11:03AM MDT until June 04 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Flooding persists across much of southwestern Yellowstone County. While the heavy rain has ended, many roadways are still impassable and flooding remains an issue. Only light rain showers are expected through the next few hours, with additional accumulations generally under a quarter of an inch. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following county, Yellowstone. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 AM MDT, emergency management reported lingering flooding in the advisory area. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused flooding in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional light rain showers have a small chance to produce amounts up to a quarter of an inch over the next few hours. This additional rain could prolong any current flooding. - Some locations that are experiencing flooding include... Billings, Laurel, Billings West End, Billings Heights, Lockwood, Shepherd, Huntley, Broadview, Acton, Comanche and Crow Indian Reservation. - Reported road closures due to flooding include... Shiloh from King to Hesper Gabel from 32nd to Zoo Dr Hesper from Shiloh to 32nd Zimmerman Trail - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
